Hi Trenton,

this is what JExample does. You can use an @Given annotation t=
o declare dependencies between producer and consumer tests. JExample extend=
s JUnit to take care of these dependencies. If the producer fails, all cons=
umers are skipped. And even better, a producer can return its fixture as re=
turn value and consumers can well consume the cache value as arguments. The=
 framework takes care to clone return values that are used  by more than on=
e consumer.

http://scg.unibe.ch/jexample

cheers,
Adrian
